attributes.action: Ensure that MP's yearly pay rises never exceed those of other public sectors
attributes.additional_details:
Between the years 2010 and 2020 the average base salary of an MP increased by £16,194.00. 

The result was by April 2020 the average MP salary was £81,932.00, this is over double the national average. This is not including expenses and income from other investments and businesses. 

https://www.theipsa.org.uk/mps-pay-and-pensions

If MPs are true leaders, they will correct this wrong and ensure going forward the IPSA improves their controls. So no increase is greater than other public sectors
attributes.background:
Every year our public sectors such as the our amazing NHS, schools and the police force see their salaries stagnate. The pay rises when given are always small and still mean a reduction in salary in relation to inflation. 

What we need is for MPs to not get preferential treatment around pay rises

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554400
